alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 8:59AM CDT until May 12 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in northwest Kansas, Rawlins and Thomas. In southwest Nebraska, Hitchcock. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This warning replaces the Flash Flood Warning in effect for the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Atwood, Trenton, Culbertson, Palisade, Rexford, Herndon and Ludell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
